description:
A peaceful 2-3 player game of tile laying, with a secret twist.

Kintsugi is the Japanese art form of repairing broken pottery with gold lacquer, to show the imperfect history of the object, and to affirm that it is better for having been broken. You are repairing a piece of pottery, then playing the role of an art critic for your opponent. You can win by being a better artist, being a better critic, or both! In true minimalist tradition, the lowest score wins!

On your turn, play a card depicting fragments of pottery onto the previously played card to connect fragments together. Try to make your color of pottery connect to make the fewest pieces. But be subtle about it; if your critic (the player to your right) can guess your color, they subtract your score from theirs at the end of the round. Play 1 round per player, adding up scores from each round, and the lowest score wins.

Black Rose Wars is a competitive fantasy game of deck-building, strategy, and combat set in the hectic universe of Nova Aetas in Italy. Each player is one of powerful mages of the Black Rose Order who aspires to become the new Supreme Magister in order to acquire the mighty power of the Black Rose Artifact and the Forgotten Magic. Mages must fight, fulfill Black Rose desires, and gain strength with their spells until their power reaches the containment threshold of the prison where they are exiled, finally freeing themselves. Each mage has at their disposal six schools of magic, each one with its own strategy to annihilate their opponents and increase their power.

At the start of the battle, mages start with a grimoire of six cards; as mages study more spells during play, their grimoire will increase. Every spell in Black Rose Wars has two different effects, increasing a player's adaptability during a fight.

Mages fight each other in a modular arena of hexagons called "rooms". They summon powerful creatures, cast destructive spells, or devise dark deceptions with their enchantments. The game system is divided into different phases. Each turn, after choosing new spells from the six schools of magic, players plan their strategy in advance, placing cards face down. Later, they reveal the played cards to kill each other, solve missions, summon creatures, or destroy the prison rooms, one against each other and against the Black Rose (the playing system).  
After being killed, mages are reborn immediately, allowing them to re-enter the fight without delay — although their death still fed energy to those mages who caused it.
The mage with the most power at the end of the battle will be crowned Supreme Magister of the Order by the Black Rose itself.

This fun and exciting game will delight children.
When it is your turn, roll the dice and press it on the chicken's breast as many times as the number of dice rolls. If nothing happens, it is the next player's turn. When the chicken coop opens and the chicken cackles and lays its egg, the player picks it up, opens it and drops the egg slab from the inside to the table. If it lands so that the egg is visible, the player has bad luck: he wins nothing in this round. If it lands so that the chicken is visible - Congratulations!
The player with the most chickens wins.

The greenskin’s passion for speed and violence is known throughout the galaxy. It is not uncommon to see (from a reasonably safe distance of course) little crowds of Orks from different klans take any excuse to launch their best Gretchinz into insane races where they pilot buggies which have been slapped together with whatever is at hand. There is no need to point out that firepower and speed are far more important than the safety of the racers when it comes to the design of such contraptions.

Now you too can recreate these frantic races, pitting these crazy speed freaks against each other. Play your cards cunningly and try to manage your attacks and movements intelligently, before your rivals have a chance to get ahead. Come on, you must finish them!

Gretchinz! is a crazy racing game for 2 to 4 players (which can be expanded to up to 8 players with a second copy of the game).

Players will be rolling their dice all at the same time. Dice indicate the type of actions that players can perform: move, attach, draw new cards, etc. The fist player to align the dice to his interest will yell “Waaagh!” and everybody else need to make do with the results they have on the table at that moment. Regarding attacks, players won’t know for sure if the cards they have at hand are good enough for their intended action. Players hold the cards in their hand in such a way that they will not be able to see the relevant side of their hands (while the rest of the players can actually see the fire power of the rest of the opponents).

Park Smarts Adventures: Yellowstone is designed to be educational and teach the players about the highways and features in Yellowstone National Park.

The game requires players to move "magnetic maneuvering pieces" around a magnetic board (with 2 sides, one for summer, and one for winter) which illustrates the sites and features of Yellowstone National Park. The goal of the game is to visit the ten most popular features of the park first. Whoever visits all the sites first wins.

Features include Old Faithful, Inspiration Point, Lamar Valley, The Chocolate Pots, and more.

The summer game pieces include: bicycle, motor home, sport utility vehicle, convertible, and jeep. The winter game pieces include: snowmobile, snowshoes, skis, sled, and snow coach.

Movement of the game pieces is determined by dice rolls.

There are 3 sections of learning question cards (15 questions in each) and a mystery deck of cards.

Information cards include the following:

About the Animals & Plants - Blue
Fun Things to Do - Purple
Fun Facts to Know - Green
Mystery Cards - Red

In a small claims court full of plaintiffs and defendants, testy judges, overworked clerks, and peace-keeping bailiffs - all of whom might be living or dead - you and your friends will see that spectral justice is done, one absurd case at a time!

Cases last a few minutes and are ridiculous. Will you be an over-the-top landlord, aggrieved at a scheduled haunting gone off the rails? Will you be a sad poltergeist who only wants to make a bad smell? In Ghost Court, you might get to be both!
Make curious and crazy word connections! Race to play your entire hand by naming examples that fit the letter and category cards.

Bounce coins on the tabletop in this miniature, football-themed version of Cornhole - Coinhole Touchdown!

There are three games you can play with this set - in every game you will be bouncing coins and trying to get them into the hole. Coins must first bounce off the playing surface in front of the board.

Bounce the coins lightly on the table about two inches from the front of the board, and win!

What face do you make when you're trying to have an intelligent conversation with the drunkest person at the party? Or when you finally reach that itchy spot on your back? How about when family movie night is interrupted by an unexpected sex scene?

Try to get your team to guess what random moment you're reacting to by just making a face! No sounds, words, or movement allowed!

To play, one team draws 4 cards from 1 of the decks (happy, sad, scared and mad). Each deck contains cards that describe a specific situation. For example, you will find situations like "A pigeon just flew right up in your face" in the scared deck.

The team picks 1 of the 4 cards to give to the facemaker on the other team. They pass that card to the facemaker who memorizes it and then gives it back. That card is shuffled in with the other 3 cards and passed to the guessers on the facemaker's team. The facemaker takes the mirror that is provided with the game to prepare their expression while their teammates read the 4 cards out loud.

When ready, the facemaker reveals their expression and must hold it while their teammates try to decide which of the 4 situations they are reacting to. If they guess correctly, they keep the card. If they are wrong, the other team gets the card. Once everyone has been the facemaker once, the teams count up their cards to see who won!

Super Party Battle is a college-themed card battle game in which players try to throw the best party on campus. It’s an age-old campus battle between the Jocks, the Greeks, the Hipsters, the Nerds, the Freshman, and the Evil Faculty? Yeah, we're intimately familiar with that. But this time, we're putting our gaming skills to work, and keeping score!

At Super Party Battle University, you and your friends will battle it out to see who's really the coolest and the most fun clique on campus. Put your party skills to the ultimate test as you fight, drink, brawl, dance, use trivia, and even sing to gain total domination over the other groups. Play wacky combos, one-off classes, and expand your party into other campus buildings to take over and throw the most epic party this school has ever seen. The game includes 4 shot glass counter cups to help you keep score, and waterproof cards so you don't have to worry about your partying ruining the party. Party on!

—description from the publisher

Enter the Endless Pass, survive the never-ending horde of the Endless, and compete with other vikings to claim the title of Conqueror of the Pass!

In Endless Pass, players fight the scaly Endless to gain glory. The pass is also filled with weapons and runes to aid in defeating Endless, while allowing you to heal yourself. Combined with your action cards like attack, defend, evade, steal, and hide, you have more ways to defeat, evade, or defend against the Endless. However, whatever Endless are not defeated continue to plague the other vikings as they walk the Pass! You may also battle the other vikings. After all, you are fighting for glory and a place in Valhalla.

The last viking standing or the first to acquire ten glory, while surviving the turn, wins the game. If none of the players survive, then the player with most glory is declared the Conqueror in Valhalla.

Players are officers aboard the SDF-1 during a Zentraedi attack! After hours of raging battle, the Zentraedi are getting ready for a final assault, the SDF-1’s systems are in ruins, and it’s chaos on the bridge! You will need to band together to fight them off. Report statuses, give commands, and keep the SDF-1 returning fire. Here they come again – BRACE FOR IMPACT!

Robotech: Brace for Impact is a real-time cooperative game that can get a little intense. Players each have a hand of cards representing problems that need to be solved. However, they must work with at least one other crew member to complete their actions. The timer is ticking and players must begin to fix their ship and return fire immediately. At the same time, the Zentraedi player will be using tactics cards from their hand, attacking with their fleet, and trying to take down the SDF-1. Can you survive the final 10 minutes of this intense firefight and save humanity?

—description from the publisher

An strategy game where you have to put all your balls in the holed board building a piramidal structure. In your turn you can put a ball in a valid spot, push a non blocked ball of your colour one position (displacing others along the way) or pass your turn.
If you push a ball outside the piramid or to an invalid position, it will be captured by the player who did the push.

Un juego de estrategia donde el objetivo es colocar todas tus bolas de color en un tablero agujereado. En tu turno puedes colocar una bola en una posición válida, empujar una bola de tu color (pudiendo desplazar otras en linea)o pasar tu turno. Si alguna bola cae fuera de la pirámide o en una posición inválida, resultará capturada por el jugador que empujó la primera bola.

Munchkin Collectible Card Game is a combat game in which players level up turn after turn, put loot into play to give themselves benefits, and attack (or bluff attacks!) against one another. Eliminate the other player first, and you win!

The Cleric & Thief Starter Set includes two 40-card decks, tokens, level dials, a six-sided die, quick-start rules, and two Hero cards. The Dwarf Cleric laughs in the face of pain as he heals himself, turn after turn, but the Elf Thief cheats and steals as often as possible...and getting caught cheating is sometimes part of her plan!

—description from the publisher

Munchkin Collectible Card Game is a combat game in which players level up turn after turn, put loot into play to give themselves benefits, and attack (or bluff attacks!) against one another. Eliminate the other player first, and you win!

The Cleric & Thief Starter Set includes two 40-card decks, tokens, level dials, a six-sided die, quick-start rules, and two Hero cards. The Centaur Warrior is a fighting machine, bristling with dangerous weapons. She faces the Halfling Ranger, who sends wave after wave...after wave...of Monsters against his enemies.

—description from the publisher

A dragon has invaded your kingdom with a promise for disaster. The common people crave for a mighty, brave and legendary hero in this time of need. And you... are part of the common people. So, you should go find some true heroes and prepare them for battle!

Hero is a cooperative and semi-cooperative game where players take the roles of common people with different trades who must prepare a hero. By using transparent cards, players can actually see how their hero looks like and how their stats change.

From a fierce minotaur paladin with golden bracers armed with a flaming great-axe and mounted in a t-rex with a scorpion tail, to a circus goblin with a bionic arm, equipped with a butter knife and a mop, leading a pink chicken army.

Players will take actions and manage resources to recruit and provide supplies to the greatest heroes while the dragon destroys their kingdom.

If there are no cards left in the kingdom deck, the players lose. If the dragon is killed, the players win.

—description from the designer

KICKSTARTER GAME WAS NOT DELIVERED

Goblins like looting.
Goblins like shooting.
Goblins hate getting shot!

Loot n' Shoot is silly shooting game for 2-4 players. Each player is armed with a rubber band gun and will try to eliminate the other player's goblins while trying to grab the most loot with their own goblins. Each goblin has it own special abilities that are activated when they are moved. Grab the right loot and you can use its magic abilities to hinder your foes. It will take keen shooting, tactical placement and clever use of the goblin powers to survive the hail of (rubber band) fire and make off with the most loot.

—description from the publisher

WHATEVER is an awkward and embarrassing adult party game. 
 With physical challenges, dares, embarrassing confessions, awkward situations, and so much more, game nights are going to get weird.

The game consists of instructions, a spinner, and 200 cards: 75 Challenge/ 75 Showdown/ 50 Penalty

Spin to determine whether you will be completing a Challenge or a Showdown. Challenge cards mean you’re on your own completing the ridiculous task. Showdown cards mean it’s you head-to-head against another player. Don’t have what it takes to attempt your card? Draw a Penalty card and pay the price until your next turn...or for the rest of the game.

Successfully complete or win a Challenge or Showdown card and keep it in your pile. First to earn five cards wins the game.

In WHATEVER you may find yourself doing things like:

Staring into the eyes of another player and going back and forth saying 'moist' until someone laughs and loses.
Getting tickled by the player with the longest fingers.
Showing the rest of the group the last thing you Googled.
Bringing all the boys to the yard with your milkshake.
And so much more.

—description from the designer

A Dice Rolling game for baseball. The game was designed by the creator of Phase 10. It was exclusively sold in K-Mart during the 1981 Christmas season. Players would roll the dice to determine if the hit was a single, double, triple, or home run and the direction of where the "hit" would go on the field. Similar to real baseball, the players would roll the dice in an alternating fashion for 9 "innings." The high score at the end of 9 innings would win the game.

Moonshiners of the Apocalypse is a morally questionable, not so cooperative mashup of town-building, 4x game for 2-4 players, with a tad of dice combat. In other words, Moonshiners is the one game you need to stay away from if you worry about dark humor, morally questionable choices and drinking with your enemies until they pass out.

Set in an alternative post-apocalyptic 1920's, players compete over exploring and re-building the deserted "Shanty Town". Explore and discover, scavenge for resources and build houses for the poor survivors. All of this while fighting off the hordes of disgruntled crowds that roam the town with the sole purpose of messing with your precious achievements. 
Did I say fight? I meant drink them under the table. Arm yourself with a crate of the strongest booze, some hangover aid and start drinking, because any unchallenged enemy will hunt you down and wreck your buildings.

Explore, expand, exploit and exterminate, scavenge for resources, raise distilleries, produce moonshine and sell it into your Saloons to maximize the profits, because when time is up, only one Hero will be able to pay for the ride out of "Shanty Town" and win the game.

—description from the publisher

Oops! The robber escaped into the town! The knights start seeking clues from the people of the town. Fortunately, the knights have got a lot of information. But it’s not complete and the knights are not satisfied. Now they try to grab more clues from each other!

The players have cards in their hands as clues on the robbery. Then, the players sort their hand cards into an ascending order. Now, the turn player plays one card face-up to another player, seeking an answer. If that player has the same card at the end of their hand, they must give it to the turn player along with the played card. So, the players start to detect the other hand cards from seeking clues.

If you have 2 or 3 players, it’s a competition to win.
If you have 4 players, it’s a two partnership game to win.
If you have 5 players, one player is solo, and the other four are two partnerships.

Elementabble is like a game of scrabble with a scientific twist.
The Players use tiles to form words on a gameboard, but instead of the Alphabet the tiles show the chemical elements of the periodic system.

Every Player draws 10 tiles and gets two "-273,15 °C" tiles. A new word has to cover one of two startingpoints on the board or use at least one element of a word already on the board or be separated by an absolute zero tile from a word on the board.
Some Elements can also be used as Joker, in that case you cannot get points from them.
The Player score points according to the atomic numbers or the atomic mass (e.g. if a Joker element is used as the element and not as Joker). There are Bonus Points for longer words.
There are 4 levels of difficulty.

The games Ends when one player reaches at least 1000 Points, no one made a new word for two rounds or a Player forms the word "Schluss" ("end").
The single player game ends at reaching 4500 Points or if the player exchanges three tiles in a row without forming a new word. The game is lost if the Player didn't reach 4500 Points.

Who am I? for adult players, new rules and with an electronic device ("palabrómetro" or "wordmeter").
You fix the electronic device around your forehead and push it. A name of a famous person will appear on it, but you can not see it. Then ask the other players yes-or-no questions to determine, "Who am I?"
You have a limited time, but if you guess corectly, push it again to play with another name, until the time is over.
Ask the right questions and combine them in just the right way, who gets more points will be the winner.

                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


Muy grande y con trompa ¿QUIÉN SOY? 
Nunca fue tan divertido tener tantas cosas en la cabeza.
Más grande que una moto, más ruidoso que un camión. Me asustan las hormigas y tengo un gran trompón ¿Quién soy? Es tu turno, tienes 90 segundos ¿acertarás esta vez?
Llega el “palabrómetro”, un generador electrónico de palabras que debes colocarte sobre la frente, él indicará a tus compañeros de partida qué personaje, película, animal o canción eres y mediante pistas tendrás que adivinarlo en un tiempo record. 
Formad dos o hasta cuatro equipos, apretad el palabrómetro  e intenta adivinar quién eres entre las más de 2000 palabras que presenta el juego: actores, personajes históricos, políticos… puedes ser cualquiera, ¡descúbrelo con las pistas que te dé tu equipo!

Park Smarts Adventures: Grand Canyon is designed to be educational and teach the players about the highways and features in the Grand Canyon National Park.

The game requires players to move "magnetic maneuvering pieces" around a magnetic board (with 2 sides) which illustrates the sites and features of Grand Canyon National Park on both the North Rim and South Rim. The goal of the game is to visit the ten most popular features of the park first. Whoever visits all the sites first wins.

The game pieces include: bicycle, motor home, sport utility vehicle, convertible, and jeep.

Movement of the game pieces is determined by dice rolls.

There are 3 sections of learning question cards (15 questions in each) and a mystery deck of cards.

Information cards include the following:

     About the Animals & Plants - Blue
     Fun Things to Do - Purple
     Fun Facts to Know - Green
     Mystery Cards - Red


—description from the publisher

After Alfred and Guthrum had arranged a truce at Exeter and with Guthrum retreating back into Mercia (Vol. 2). Alfred must have assumed that the West Saxons could once again to look forward to a prolonged period of peace. But within five months Guthrum had reinforced his army and on the twelfth night, while the Saxons celebrated there holy period, Guthrum and his Viking Allies launched a surprise attack at Alfred's Royal estate at Cippanhamm. Through good intelligence, good fortitude and/or plain good luck Alfred was able to escape and with a handful of followers made his way to the marshes of the Somerset Levels.
It is here in the most inhospitable of conditions of sea-flooded swamp that Alfred, with a handful of followers, was to make a seemingly impregnable fortress at Althelney. It was from that King Alfred was to launch a guerilla campaign against his Viking tormentors. Within five months the King's forces defeated the Viking Army of Guthrum in a pitched battle at Ethandun.
Though Alfred entered the marsh with a small number of loyal followers we also know that he was not completely without allies. Odda Ealdorman of Devonshire was protecting Athelney by controlling the River Perret from Cynuit Hillfort, and was to do battle there with the legendary Ubbe Lothbrok (son of Ragnar) Alfred also had the support of Ealdorman of Somerset, Aethelnoth, who had also been fighting the Vikings from the Somerset levels. Aethelnoth's support was in no doubt instrumental in helping Alfred regroup and plan his campaign to reclaim Wessex.
Not all of Alfred's Earls were as loyal as Odda and Aethelnoth, and in this game the Saxons of Wiltshire are in a state of civil war with their warriors split between loyalty for their King and a Saxon controlled Wessex. It is there that the treacherous Ealdorman, Wulfhere, gained control and sided with the Viking invaders.
The Viking strength was in their professional and aggressive soldiery skills. Their weaknesses were often in the re-supply of fighting men and the fact the West Saxons were fighting for their home.
Kings are of great importance in this series of games. When they are leading the warriors in combat your moral and thereby fighting ability is increased, without them weakened. Of course the loss of a King in battle can also mean the loss of your cause. However, in this era risks must be taken to take and hold the crown.
Sharpen your sword and pick up your shield for the call has gone out, 'the King is on the march'…………………

—description from the publisher

Based on Eric Carle's best-selling book, players spend a fun-filled day Around the Farm helping baby animals find their way home. Help baby pigs locate the pigpen, baby ducks waddle to the pond, baby horses trot to the hayfield, and baby sheep back to their pasture. The game introduces children to counting and identifying baby and adult animals. Counting is especially fun as the players make animal sounds for each animal they move. Everyone wins in this cooperative game when each baby animal has been reunited with its adult animal!

Race the clock, it's not so hard! Dig out 6 objects, place on your card.

When each player has gone ALL IN, match one more for the win!

I SPY Dig In is the great game of frantic finding! Kids practice literacy, coordination, and social skills as they race to match the images on their cards with objects from the bowl.

—description from the publisher

Take a Spin with Vampirina in this exciting twist on bingo! Spin to see where you can play. Match the color, pattern, shape or character. If you get Spin Go Round, everyone switches spinners! You never know when the game will take a batty turn!

—description from the publisher

This new starter set includes everything two players need to start playing Star Trek: Attack Wing, and provides current players with a wealth of new and never-before-seen content.  Crack it open and start exploring and battling in the Alpha Quadrant today!

Included in this new set are 36 cards, dials, bases, pegs, tokens, dice, and 4 newly repainted ships (the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, the U.S.S. Sutherland, K'mpec's Attack Cruiser and the I.K.S. Vorn).

Crazy Neighbors is a humorous game, where the players assume the roles of residents in a suburban neighborhood populated by a cast of crazy stereotypes.

Each player belongs to one of four exaggerated demographic groups, the Hippies, the Rednecks, the Culture Snobs or the Moneybags. The people belonging to the different groups obviously cannot stand each other, and the goal of the game is to make sure that your preferred type of people move in to your neighborhood, and that the properties surrounding your opponents are populated by people they dislike. Meanwhile you can also upgrade your own property and bring all kinds of misfortune to your opponents.

The game plays with all kinds of stereotypes in a tongue-in-cheek manner. For the duration of the game, each player will identify with their own demographic and try to be as outrageously mean as possible to her opponents.

The large cast of neighbors are represented by cards with individual abilities and descriptions, each illustrated by the gifted artist Erik Ødegaard.

—description from the publisher

The Triade de Diamants, three identical diamonds, having broken the laws of nature, have become a marvel gracing the greatest museums on earth. Until now...

Jack Sly is a diamond thief attempting to become a legend by collecting all three diamonds. Gregory Lestrade III, descendant of Scotland Yard's Inspector Lestrade, is determined to create his own legacy, by bringing the master thief to justice.

In Sly, a puzzle card game for 1-2 players, Sly sneaks across the cards representing three museums, endeavoring to manipulate them to his advantage, uses the tricks of the trade to snatch the diamonds, and attempts to escape before the police can catch up with him. Will you get away, or wind up imprisoned? If you can't take the heat, you're not Jack Sly.

—description from the designer

Hintegers is the social game of figuring out what number someone is thinking of. Each turn, the Hint Giver provides a one word hint related to their category, and secretly selects a number 1 through 10. The other players then play a card trying to match the number. Stumped? Use a lifeline! As the Hint Giver, be sure not to give easy hints as only the players that match get one step closer to winning! The object of the game it get down to having only 3 numbers left in your hand, and you get rid of numbers by successfully guessing (or giving a successful hint!) Laugh and Learn in this thought provoking party game, it's as easy as picking a number 1 through 10.

Football dice.
Play soccer with 4 dice.
You can throw your dice 3 times and choose wich one to get or to reroll. You need results with the color of your team, and one die with corner, penalty or goal symbol. After 3 throws, your turn is over.
You must take notes fo the scorings. The player who scores most goals will be the winner.

                                                                                                            
                                                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


Juega al fútbol con 4 dados.
Con toda la emoción del fútbol. Goles, penaltis, córners y faltas.
Juega con tus amigos y amigas creando vuestras propias ligas. Es muy divertido. No podrás parar de jugar. Se venden con una bolsita para que se puedan llevar cómodamente a cualquier parte y no se pierdan.

Golf dice.
Play golf with 5 dice.
One die shows the hole objective. You can throw your dice and choose wich one to get or to reroll. You need to reach the distance shown on the objective die, and a blue or green flag depending of the objective. When you reach the objective, you compare your number of throws with the par of the hole and score points consequently.
You must take notes fo the scorings. The player who scores less points will be the winner.

                                                                                                            
                                                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


Juega un partido de golf con 5 dados
Con toda la emoción de un partido de golf. Lanzamientos, distancias, hoyos, pares, birdies y bogeys.
Juega con tus amigos y amigas creando vuestros propios partidos. Es muy divertido. No podrás parar de jugar. Se venden con una bolsita para que se puedan llevar cómodamente a cualquier parte y no se pierdan.

Co co pio is a card game in which the aim is to be the first to get your hens to have three chicks.
Each player must play thir cards:
- to protect their farm with the dog or the incubator
- make it grow with eggs or chicks
- or to pester your opponents' farms with magpies, foxes, worms, cats, ...

Betrayal Legacy marries the concept of Betrayal at House on the Hill — exploring a haunted mansion — with the permanency and multi-game storytelling exhibited by Daviau's Risk Legacy and other legacy games that followed. Betrayal Legacy consists of a prologue and a thirteen-chapter story that takes place over decades. Players represent families, with specific members of a family participating in one story, then perhaps an older version of those characters (assuming they lived) or their descendants showing up in later stories.

Why would people keep exploring a haunted mansion for decade after decade, especially when horrible things happen there? Curiosity, I suppose, or perhaps an ignorant boldness that comes from the belief that we know better than those who have come before. Look at all that we've learned, marvel at the tools we have at hand! Surely we'll all exit safely this time...

As with other Betrayal titles, the game is narratively-driven, with elements that record the history of your specific games. The tools mentioned earlier, for example, become attached to specific families. This isn't just a bucket; it's my bucket, the one my grandpappy used to feed his family's pigs when he was a boy, and while you can certainly use that bucket, I know how to wield it best from the time he spent teaching me how to slop. Yes, it's an heirloom bucket, and when kept in the family, I get a bonus for using it.

This hidden set-up war game is an unusual WWII adaptation of the classic L'Attaque. What makes it most unusual is that the rules are dated 11/44, which means it must have been one of the first French games published after the liberation.

This is a more complex game than L'Attaque or its successor Stratego. Its name translates as "The Lightning War" (or Blitzkrieg), and this is reflected in the mix of pieces.

Whereas L'Attaque and its successor Stratego simply used numerically ranked pieces, this game includes a host of WWII-era innovations as well, with pieces representing parachutists, bombers, anti-aircraft guns, delayed-action bombs, flying bombs and a tanker-truck that must survive to keep the bombers flying. Missing from the mix is any kind of armored unit, but there are "magnetic fences" that somehow disable the engines of aeroplanes.

Movement and combat is much more flexible than in the basic L'Attaque. Pieces may move in any direction, including diagonally, and may attack any piece orthogonally adjacent. To win, players must capture both the opponent's flag and its "secret plan".

Pairs of cards are laid out on the table. One card in each pair shows a body movement/gesture and a phrase, the other one a letter or number. Some of these pairs are open, some are concealed after everyone had a look at them. During the game, additional pairs are added.
Players take turns flipping open cards from a personal pile of cards. When a letter or number appears that is in one of the pairs, everyone has to either do the gesture or say the phrase or both (depending on the agreed difficulty level) on the matching card. The last player to do this has to take all the open cards. The first player to get rid of all their cards is the winner.

A set collection game based on emoticons, where players take turns to perform an action from one set of cards before drawing and discarding one emoticon from their hand.
The first to have a set of five cards in the same emotional set (potentially including wildcards) must declare their emotion and put the hand on the table.

Lotus is a Go-like game where captured pieces swap colors. The goal is to claim the most territory -- pieces and any empty points they surround. It's played on the 72 intersections flower-shaped board, just like the better known, Kensington.

Instead of placing a piece on his turn, a player can pull the point track marker one step in his direction. This score is added to the territory count at the end.

Game teaching kids to draw. A player draws a card, tries to draw it, and the other players try to guess what it is. 
—User summary

Cube Conundrum is a simple-to-learn game that can be played in about 10-15 minutes but is designed to be extremely flexible and provide a different game every time, depending on how you set up the board.

Players use action cards to move their cubes from start to finish along a hexagonal path. The cards send each cube forward or backward one space on every turn. Depending on the cards in your hand, you may have no choice but to help your fellow players. However, chances are good they'll be repaying you in the future.

Every card affects every player on every turn. Choose Wisely!

The hexagonal path includes advanced/harder gameplay options for those looking for a longer game with some twists and turns. While strategy does play a role in this game, there is an equal element of luck-of-the-draw as well.

—description from the publisher

Core Space is a science fiction miniatures board game. Each player takes control of a band of Traders trying to make a living in a dangerous galaxy, all the while hunted by the Purge, a semi-sentient race of humanoid machines whose sole task is to harvest worlds.

A game of Core Space takes place on a detailed 3D board. Your Traders must explore the area, fulfil their objectives, salvage what they can and then escape back to their ship, spending their earnings on desperately-needed repairs. The exciting campaign system will track your crew from game to game, developing their skills, upgrading their equipment and telling their story.

This core set accommodates 1-2 players, but the game supports up to 6 players using additional Trader crews, available separately.

Contents

8 Trader Miniatures
        The Crew of the Black Maria
        The Crew of the Ion Hope
    9 Purge Miniatures
    3 Civilian Miniatures
    8 Plastic Crew Dashboards
    11 Character Boards
    8 Class Boards
    1 Purge Board
    2 Ship Boards
    1 Plastic Hostility Tracker
    7 Dice
    20 Event Cards
    104-Page Rulebook
    42 Counters & 189 Plastic Pegs
    Token Pouch with over 100 Equipment Tokens
    And finally, a 2'/60cm square gaming mat with over 130 terrain pieces to build your board!

It's the game that features a surprising mix of characters, amazingly simple rules and the right touch of cleverness.

Each player starts with 3 tiles.  On every turn place one of your tiles on any open space on the board.  But look carefully so you don't place a tile that will help your opponents score as you try to get three in a row - vertically, horizontally or diagonally.

When you're successful, collect a token.  On some especially good moves you can get 2 or 3 tokens.  
At the end of the game when the board is full of zombies, princesses and that kid next door, the player with the most tokens wins.

Tactical Space Combat - 22nd Century

Star Command brings the future to you!

Star Command is the tactical game of space combat in the 22nd century between the Terran Federation and the felinoid Shaanthra. Designed with both board gamers and miniature gamers in mind, Star Command uses simultaneous movement and fire featuring laser and missile weapons in starships using gravitic drives and hyperdrives for faster than light movement. Rules are included for strategic play and spacecraft markers are provided so that you may begin to enjoy the game immediately without buying expensive models. Additional rules for three-dimensional play.
—description from the publisher

Set in the same fictional universe as Kurtick's Strike Team Alpha.

Insulting at the highest level!

Have you always wanted to fool the elves, witches, orcs and magicians of their unconstructive mindset? Use your non-existent tact and inexhaustible creativity to verbally humiliate your companions as efficiently as possible. With each new game, new unique combinations of insults are created that you can hand out to your comrades. But beware, because your companions also have some quick-witted insults that they would love to hand over to you.

The game is being played by players drafting cards from a common pool, creating their humiliation as a phrase. A grammatically correct sentence, no matter if it makes sense or not, can be used against an opponent to shame him publically, giving him penalty points. Some races are offended and thus humilated more by specific words than others. Once a player has accumulated 30 points or more through insults of the other players, he is eliminated from the game, though there are a couple of proposed house rule which allow for different ways to play this game.

Patrimonia Amsterdam is a strategic board game for 2 to 6 people. By manoeuvring your boat tactically through the canals, collecting the right materials and being the first to finish building your monuments, you can win. But be careful, some monuments are worth more than others. Also watch out for the other players! Using shrewd negotiation tactics and a clever choice of profession they can mess up your game. Also keeping things on edge are the luck or lose cards. Who sinks his boat and who sails away towards victory? 
Patrimonia Amsterdam is an addictive board game, exciting till the last second.

Purpose of the game:
Sailing the canals you collect foundations, building materials and permits to renovate monuments, and by doing so, you help conserve the historical city centre of Amsterdam.
Has a player finished renovating all his monuments? This is when the last round will be played. The player who has the most points at the end, wins.

—description from the designer

Prepare your stool, draw your cards, and get ready for Tavern Trouble – the fast paced card game that’s easy to learn and highly fun. You’ll play your cards to control the many travelers of the well-known establishment the Crowned Frog and use their special powers in great brawls.

Elements of the game
A deck includes 27 characters cards with power from 1 to 9. To keep the scores, each player has a card squared from 0 to 25 (these go by the original name of “life points”). At the beginning of the game, each player put his life token on the 20 square(during the game it is not possible to go with a score higher than 25 life points).

Win the game
There is only one way to win the game. When a player loses all his life points, he is eliminated. The game ends when there is only one player with life points.

Walkthrough
The game is played in a succession of turns, where the players will try to reduce the life points of their opponents. A turn includes 4 phases:
A. deal
B. draw
C. play an ability
D. reveal & score

This trivia game is "For those who know Newfoundland and for those who want to know it better."

"Newfoundlandia is a cultural experience probing our past and present. Dabble in Viking lore. Recall the Smallwood Era. Saunter through the alleyways of North America's oldest city."

The ARTS & CULTURE category tests your knowledge of Newfoundland's life  style, language, music, literature, arts and sports. PEOPLE & POLITICS draws on your knowledge of politics past and present and your ability to recall who's who and who was who in Newfoundland. HISTORY & GEOGRAPHY deals mainly with the events of our past, nomenclature, and general geographic knowledge. The TOWNIE TRIVIA section is designed to test your knowledge of St. John's, past and present.

Although every culture has its unique features, Newfoundland, to Newfoundlanders, is more than a quaint place. It's home. Newfoundlandia is about our land, our people and our ways. Based on our history, geography, and culture NEWFOUNDLANDIA will provide hours of entertainment for Newfoundlanders at home and abroad.
